entry.content:
About me

I'm a PhD student studying computer science at UC Davis interested in theoretical computer science and quantum computing. I like to focus on quantum complexity theory, quantum algorithms, and fault tolerance. I'm advised by Greg Kuperberg. I participate in a few quantum computing groups at Davis, which I usually advertise on the side links of my homepage. Worked out problems, expository writings, and my lecture notes from various seminars may occasionally make their way here. Feel free to use them or email me corrections/comments.

Previously I was a Master's student of computer science at Davis, and before that I did my undergraduate in pure mathematics at Towson University under the advisement of Angel Kumchev.

Reading Groups

  • Quantum Complexity & PCP Conjecture
  • Topological QFTs
  • Exercises/Problems
